required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Specified Drug-use Survey on Abilify Prolonged Release Aqueous Suspension for IM Injection (Prevention of Relapse of Mood Episodes in BP)
clinical_study.official_title: Abilify Prolonged Release Aqueous Suspension for Intramuscular Injection Specified Drug-use Results Survey (Prevention of Recurrence/Relapse of Mood Episodes in Bipolar I Disorder)

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the safety for an observation period of 52 weeks with use of Abilify prolonged release aqueous suspension for intramuscular (IM) injection in patients with bipolar I disorder for prevention of recurrence/relapse of mood episodes in the routine clinical setting. The early stage safety after the switching from oral aripiprazole to this IM injection is investigated including extrapyramidal syndrome and malignant syndrome. Information regarding efficacy is collected as well.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 52 weeks from the start date of Abilify prolonged release aqueous suspension for IM injection therapy
primary_outcome.description: Any untoward medicinal occurrence in a patient or clinical study subject administered a Medicinal Product and which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment (ICH-E2A Guideline). An Adverse Event can therefore be any unfavorable and unintended sign (e.g. abnormal laboratory finding), symptom, or disease temporally associated with the use of a Medicinal Product (Abilify Prolonged Release Aqueous Suspension), whether or not it is considered causally related to the Medicinal Product.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Special Situations (e.g. Maternal (pregnancy and breastfeeding) exposure, paternal (via semen) exposure or Overdose/Incorrect dosage)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 52 weeks from the start date of Abilify prolonged release aqueous suspension for IM injection therapy
52 weeks from the start date of Abilify prolonged release aqueous suspension for IM injection therapy
primary_outcome.description: Collecting any type of off-Label Use that refers to situations where a product is intentionally used for a medical purpose not in accordance with the authorized product information. Off-label use also includes the intentional use in non-authorized population categories not indicated in the label. (Safety Information)

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Serious Adverse Event (e.g. resulting in death or life-threatening)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 52 weeks from the start date of Abilify prolonged release aqueous suspension for IM injection therapy
primary_outcome.description: Collecting the number of any adverse drug experience/event occurring at any dose which results in death is life-threatening requires inpatient hospitalization or prolonged of existing hospitalization results in persistent or significant disability or incapacity is a congenital anomaly/birth defect is medically significant. (Safety Information)

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Non-serious Adverse Events (i.e. all Adverse Events that do not meet the definition of a serious Adverse Event)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 52 weeks from the start date of Abilify prolonged release aqueous suspension for IM injection therapy
primary_outcome.description: Collecting the number of non-serious Adverse Events (Safety Information)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients who recurrence/relapse of Mood Episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 52 weeks from the start date of Abilify prolonged release aqueous suspension for IM injection therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Collecting the number of patients who recurrence/relapse of Mood Episodes (Efficacy Information)

intervention.intervention_name: Abilify prolonged release aqueous suspension for IM injection (Aripiprazole)
intervention.description: The usual dose in adults is 400 mg of aripiprazole administered intramuscularly in the gluteal or deltoid muscle as a single dose once every 4 weeks. The dose may be decreased to 300 mg based on the patient's symptoms and tolerability.

study_pop.textblock: Patients in Japan with bipolar I disorder who are planned to be newly started on Abilify prolonged release aqueous suspension for IM injection, switching from oral aripiprazole for the purpose of prevention of recurrence/relapse of mood episodes

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with a known hypersensitivity to aripiprazole

overall_contact.last_name: Pharmacovigilance Department Otsuka Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd
